Indonesia Circular Economy Forum Digelar 11-12 November 2019
07 Nov 2019, 15:15 by Fajar Pebrianto, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesia Circular Economy Forum kembali diadakan untuk ketiga kalinya, yaitu pada 11-12 November 2019. Forum ini bakal menghadirkan para pengambil keputusan dari berbagai sektor: pemerintah, swasta, akademisi, dalam upaya mengimplementasikan solusi ekonomi sirkular bagi dunia usaha, manajemen kota, dan kehidupan masyarakat sehari-hari.
“Transisi dari konsep linear menjadi ekonomi sirkular adalah satu-satunya langkah menuju masa depan,” kata Duta Besar Uni Eropa untuk Indonesia, Bapak Vincent Piket, dalam keterangan resmi di Jakarta, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Vincent mengatakan, ekosistem bumi saat ini sudah menanggung beban yang begitu besar. Menurut dia, manusia sekarang telah menggunakan sumber daya bumi sebanyak 1,7 kali dari yang dapat digantikan secara alami. “Kita menghabiskan modal alam yang seharusnya dinikmati oleh generasi masa depan.”
Sehingga, ekonomi sirkular menjadi salah satu ide yang ditawarkan. Pendekatan ini telah menjadi elemen utama dalam kegiatan industri dan strategi ekonomi Uni Eropa. Di tengah dunia dengan sumberdaya terbatas ini, kata dia, transisi menuju ekonomi sirkular sangat mungkin terjadi juga di Indonesia. “Kita dapat bekerjasama untuk mempercepat dan memfasilitasi perubahan tersebut. bersama-sama." kata dia.
Vincent juga menguraikan bahwa ekonomi sirkular merupakan pendekatan yang strategis untuk memastikan penumbuhan ekonomi yang berkelanjutan. Selain itu, Ekonomi Sirkular juga sudah mendapat perhatian besar dunia karena dipercaya dapat membantu mencapai 134 target dalam Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Forum ini sendiri diadakan organisasi Greeneration Foundation Forum yang tahun ini mengangkat tema “Towards a Sustainable Future through Circular Business Practices”, akan dihadiri oleh sekitar 400 peserta.
Direktur Eksekutif Greeneration Foundation, Vanessa Letizia, menjelaskan bahwa Indonesia telah menuangkan konsep ekonomi sirkular dalam hal pengurangan limbah dan penanganan sampah terpadu. Hal ini termuat dalam Peraturan Presiden Nomo 97 Tahun 2017 tentang Strategi dan Kebijakan Nasional (Jakstranas). “Perubahan menuju ekonomi sirkular mensyaratkan partisipasi semua pihak,” kata dia.
Untuk itu, Greeneration Foundation menghadirkan berbagai narasumber, baik dari dalam maupun luar negeri. Salah satunya yaitu Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan. Para narasumber ini yang akan membantu mengidentiflkasi tantangan dan potensi ekonomi sirkular di Indonesia. “Serta berbagi pengalaman kolaborasi mereka dengan berbagai pihak,” ujamya.
Selain oleh Uni Eropa, forum ini disponsori oleh Pemerintah Norwegia, Pemerintah Denmark, Pemerintah Belanda dan the Academy of Medical Sciences. Forum tahun ini juga mendapat dukungan dari Pemerintah Finlandia, Waste4Change, PRAISE, Systemiq, Universitas Indonesia, Coventry University, Blue Economy Foundation, Global Compact Network, GIZ, IATL ITB, MVB, McKinsey.org dan Napindo.

Indonesia Circular Economy Forum Held November 11-12, 2019
Nov 7 2019, 15:15 by Fajar Pebrianto, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesia Circular Economy Forum is held again for the third time, on 11-12 November 2019. This forum will present decision makers from various sectors: government, private sector, academia, in an effort to implement a circular economic solution for the business world , city management and people's daily lives.
"The transition from the linear concept to a circular economy is the only step towards the future," said the EU Ambassador to Indonesia, Mr. Vincent Piket, in an official statement in Jakarta, Thursday, 7 November 2019.
Vincent said, the earth's ecosystem currently has to bear a huge burden. According to him, humans now use 1.7 times the earth's resources which can be replaced naturally. "We are depleting natural capital that should be enjoyed by future generations."
Thus, circular economy is one of the ideas offered. This approach has become a major element in industrial activity and the economic strategy of the European Union. In the middle of a world with limited resources, he said, the transition to a circular economy is very likely to occur also in Indonesia. "We can work together to accelerate and facilitate these changes. together. "he said.
Vincent also explained that the circular economy is a strategic approach to ensure sustainable economic growth. In addition, the Circular Economy has also received great attention from the world because it is believed to be able to help reach 134 targets in Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
This forum is organized by the Greeneration Foundation Forum, which this year has the theme "Towards a Sustainable Future through Circular Business Practices", which will be attended by around 400 participants.
The Executive Director of the Greeneration Foundation, Vanessa Letizia, explained that Indonesia had poured the concept of a circular economy in terms of waste reduction and integrated waste management. This is contained in Presidential Regulation No. 97 of 2017 concerning National Strategy and Policy (Jakstranas). "Changes to the circular economy require the participation of all parties," he said.
To that end, the Greeneration Foundation presents a variety of sources, both from within and outside the country. One of them is the Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan. These speakers will help identify the challenges and circular economic potential in Indonesia. "And share their collaboration experiences with various parties," he said.
Apart from the European Union, this forum is sponsored by the Norwegian Government, the Danish Government, the Dutch Government and the Academy of Medical Sciences. This year's forum also received support from the Government of Finland, Waste4Change, PRAISE, Systemiq, University of Indonesia, Coventry University, Blue Economy Foundation, Global Compact Network, GIZ, IATL ITB, MVB, McKinsey.org and Napindo.
